header_summary: Jonas suggests verifying previous challenges to mitigate potential attacks on statechains.Blocking inscriptions on the Bitcoin network is debated due to concerns of censorship.Taproot is mentioned as a solution to handle large amounts of data on the blockchain.Discussions cover unconfirmed inputs in coinjoin transactions, package relay, and `keysend` protocol.

recent_posts.title: Fwd:  Blinded 2-party Musig2
recent_posts.summary:
- @Jonas suggests verifying previous challenges to mitigate potential attacks on the statechains scheme.
- The sender records specific values along with the message and sends them to the receiver.
- The receiver verifies the values received and checks for any inconsistencies to ensure validity.

recent_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions".
recent_posts.summary:
- Spam attacks on the Bitcoin network through inscriptions are a topic of discussion.
- Blocking inscriptions may not effectively solve the underlying problems of the network.
- The issue requires addressing the larger challenges of download time and UTXO size.

recent_posts.title: Denial of Service using Package Relay
recent_posts.summary:
- In an email on 07/06/2023, a user raised concerns about accepting unconfirmed inputs in coinjoin.
- The user mentioned risks of allowing unconfirmed inputs and suggested coordinator B should not accept them.
- They also discussed the benefits of package relay and upcoming RBF proposals for coinjoin transactions.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- Proposed scheme allows for multipath payments by using a `keysend` protocol with TLV 5482373484.
- Sender splits `keysend` into two parts, one with `a` and the other with `a ^ p`.
- Receiver holds the payment until all parts arrive, XORs preimages to claim funds.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- Our team has been recording and transcribing specification meetings since the beginning of the year.
- Transcripts of these meetings are now available for everyone to access.
- Gurwinder from Chaincode ensured the accuracy of the transcripts and maintained their quality.

recent_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
recent_posts.summary:
- Participants discussed Bitcoin network policies and potential solutions to address issues.
- Multiple goals were identified, including fair transaction selection without monopolistic advantages.
- Various proposals were made, such as implementing monetary measures to mitigate channel jamming.

active_posts.title: Standardisation of an unstructured taproot annex
active_posts.summary:
- The taproot annex is currently non-standard, and standardization discussions lean towards a flexible TLV format.
- A proposal suggests allowing non-structured taproot annex to facilitate immediate utilization, future flexibility, and chainspace efficiency.
- This approach broadens the scope of taproot annex usage while preserving the possibility of a structured format in the future.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- A version of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains is being discussed.
- The server (party 1) needs to be fully blinded to certain information.
- The security of blinded statechains relies on trusting the server's report of partial signatures.

active_posts.title: On the experiment of the Bitcoin Contracting Primitives WG and marking this community process "up for grabs"
active_posts.summary:
- The failure of the CTV speedy trial led to the introduction of a new community process to specify covenants.
- Various initiatives were undertaken, including the bitcoin-inquisition fork and archiving covenant proposals.
- The author prioritizes Lightning development but encourages others to continue working on covenant changes proposals.

active_posts.title: HTLC Endorsement for Jamming Mitigation
active_posts.summary:
- The email updates on channel jamming and announces the next call on May 1st.
- The group plans to gather data on HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking for jamming mitigation.
- They propose a reputation scheme and endorse HTLCs as the first step in mitigating channel jamming.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- LNbits team patched an exploit that allowed attackers to create balances through invoice manipulation.
- Users are advised to update to LNbits version 0.10.5 to protect against the exploit.
- Developers should take precautions with internal payment lookups and invoice tampering.

active_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
active_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network offer privacy benefits to receiving nodes.
- Payments can only be made through given paths, potentially favoring compliant nodes.
- This approach impacts decentralization and compromises sender-side privacy in the network.
